intro: Pericallis cruenta, commonly known as the showy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and sturdy stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Pericallis cruenta is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
